conbody.p: This document describes its own formatting in order to allow the reader changing XSL-FO page parameters through intuitive progress. There's nothing better than Leigh White's book [DtPrt#1] which is the best entry point ever to understand the mechanisms of XSL-FO. Yet after reading the book you might still need some search to modify layouts. This documents concludes the learning of the book by pointers to the places that are relevant for the format of the document.

section.title: About the abstract
section.p: The abstract usually serves as short summary of the content to be expected in an article or book. The topic is described in [DitaSpec#3.2.5.1.8].
Like the notices and the preface, the abstract is also part of the frontmatter [Ditaspec#3.2.5.1.19] section of a ditamap.
